intro: Diplusodon panniculatus, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are typically clustered in terminal panicles. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Diplusodon panniculatus is often found in wetlands and along waterways in tropical regions of the Americas.
